question: Read the passage below and choose the most appropriate transition word or phrase to fill in the blank.
text: In Moby-Dick, Herman Melville explores the consequences of obsession through the character of Captain Ahab. Ahab’s relentless pursuit of the white whale, Moby Dick, becomes his all-consuming goal, blinding him to the risks faced by his crew. _____, his obsession ultimately leads to his downfall and the destruction of the Pequod.
explanation:
Correct choice B: Consequently
The correct answer, "Consequently," indicates the cause-and-effect relationship between Ahab’s obsession and the tragic outcome of the story. The word effectively connects Ahab’s relentless pursuit to the eventual destruction it causes.
A) In addition would incorrectly suggest that the destruction was an added detail, failing to highlight the causal connection.
C) Nevertheless would suggest a contrast, which does not align with the clear progression of cause and effect in this sentence.
D) For example would imply the sentence provides an illustration of a broader idea, which is not the case here.
